Package com.rb.nonbiz.collections

Class ClosedUnitFractionRangeUtilities

java.lang.Object
com.rb.nonbiz.collections.ClosedUnitFractionRangeUtilities
public class ClosedUnitFractionRangeUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
Various static functions pertaining to ClosedUnitFractionRange objects.

We would normally have named this as the plural of ClosedUnitFractionRange, and follow the usual convention, but ClosedUnitFractionRanges already an existing class.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ClosedUnitFractionRangeUtilities()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static ClosedUnitFractionRange loosenClosedUnitFractionRangeByFixedAmount​(ClosedUnitFractionRange initialRange, UnitFraction fixedCushionBetweenHardAndSoftRange)
    "Stretches" a ClosedUnitFractionRange to become bigger on each side by a fixed UnitFraction, up to [0, 1].
    static java.util.Optional<ClosedUnitFractionRange> optionalClosedUnitFractionRangeIntersection​(ClosedUnitFractionRange range1, ClosedUnitFractionRange range2)
    Returns Optional.empty() if the two ranges have nothing in common; otherwise, returns the intersection.
    static ClosedUnitFractionRange possiblyLoosenToContainPoint​(ClosedUnitFractionRange initialRange, UnitFraction pointToContain)
    If a ClosedUnitFractionRange does not already contain a point, we will 'loosen' it to contain it.

    E.g.

  • Constructor Details

    • ClosedUnitFractionRangeUtilities

      public ClosedUnitFractionRangeUtilities()

  • Method Details

    • tightenClosedUnitFractionRangeAround

      public static ClosedUnitFractionRange tightenClosedUnitFractionRangeAround​(ClosedUnitFractionRange initialRange, UnitFraction centerOfRange, UnitFraction fractionToTightenOnEachSide)
      E.g. tightening the range [0.2, 0.6] with a center of 0.5 by 0.1 (10%) gives [0.23, 0.59]

    • loosenClosedUnitFractionRangeByFixedAmount

      public static ClosedUnitFractionRange loosenClosedUnitFractionRangeByFixedAmount​(ClosedUnitFractionRange initialRange, UnitFraction fixedCushionBetweenHardAndSoftRange)
      "Stretches" a ClosedUnitFractionRange to become bigger on each side by a fixed UnitFraction, up to [0, 1].

    • tightenClosedUnitFractionRangeProportionally

      public static ClosedUnitFractionRange tightenClosedUnitFractionRangeProportionally​(ClosedUnitFractionRange initialRange, UnitFraction startingPoint, ClosedUnitFractionHardToSoftRangeTighteningInstructions closedUnitFractionHardToSoftRangeTighteningInstructions)
      E.g. [40%, 50%] tightened using a multiplier of 0.8 for upper and lower will give [ 41%, 49% ] using a multiplier of 0 for upper and lower, this would become [ 45%, 45% ].

      Using an upper multiplier of 0.5 and a lower multiplier of 0.8 would give [ 41%, 47.5% ].

      There is a notion of a 'starting point', which is the point we used to generate the initialRange. For example, the starting point may have been 45% in the initial range of [40%, 50%] - but it does not necessarily have to be the center. It does have to be an interior point though in the initial range.

    • possiblyLoosenToContainPoint

      public static ClosedUnitFractionRange possiblyLoosenToContainPoint​(ClosedUnitFractionRange initialRange, UnitFraction pointToContain)
      If a ClosedUnitFractionRange does not already contain a point, we will 'loosen' it to contain it.

      For instance, [0.3, 0.7] will be changed to [0.2, 0.7] using pointToContain = 0.2.

    • optionalClosedUnitFractionRangeIntersection

      public static java.util.Optional<ClosedUnitFractionRange> optionalClosedUnitFractionRangeIntersection​(ClosedUnitFractionRange range1, ClosedUnitFractionRange range2)
      Returns Optional.empty() if the two ranges have nothing in common; otherwise, returns the intersection.
